tools.cutie package¶

Submodules¶

tools.cutie.preprocessing module¶

tools.cutie.preprocessing.check_box_dictionary(image_path: str, box_dict: dict)¶

Opens a new window showing the image and the boxes found in the dictionary given as parameter.

Parameters

  • image_path (str) – path to the image

  • box_dict (dict) – dictionary prepared with divide_boxes function

tools.cutie.preprocessing.convert_json_to_tensors(json_file: str, embedding_fun: Callable, grid_size: int = 64, embedding_size: int = 128, N_class: int = 5)¶

Converts the annotations json file to two tensors : one for the grid with the word embeddings, one for the classes of the words.

Parameters

  • json_file (dict) – dictionary prepared with generate_grids function

  • embedding_fun (function) – function converting a word to its embedding vector

  • grid_size (int) – number of rows/columns in the output grid, default 64

  • embedding_size (int) – size of the word embedding vectors, default = 128

  • N_class (int) – Number of classes to predict, default = 5

Returns

The two tensors of the grid and the classes

Return type

tuple(torch.tensor torch.tensor)

tools.cutie.preprocessing.distilbert_embedding(text, tokenizer, model)¶
tools.cutie.preprocessing.divide_boxes(via_file: str) → dict¶

Divides the boxes containing several words in the via annotations file given as parameter. Returns a dictionary with the information of each box : filename, class, word, x, y, width, height.

Parameters

via_file (str) – path to the via csv file

Returns

dictionary with the boxes information

Return type

dict

tools.cutie.preprocessing.dress_text(text: str)¶

Dress a text, replacing numbers by ‘0’

Parameters

text (str) – string to be dressed

Returns

dressed string

Return type

str

tools.cutie.preprocessing.generate_1_vocab(json_file: str, grid_size: int)¶

Generates the vocabulary of the words contained in a json annotation file.

Parameters

  • json_file (str) – path to the json_file file

  • grid_size (int) – grid size that will be used in Cutie

Returns

list of the sentences found in the json file (1 sentence / line)

Return type

list

tools.cutie.preprocessing.generate_cutie_jsons(via_file: str)¶

Generate the json files of the images contained in an annotation file, in the needed format for cutie training.

Parameters

  • via_file (str) – path to the via csv file

  • embedding_fun (callable) – word embedding function

tools.cutie.preprocessing.generate_grids(json_file: str, grid_size: int = 64, known_class: bool = True) → dict¶

Generates a grid of words per image, based on the json file containing the annotations. Returns the grid information in a dictionary with the format : { ‘image’ : str,

‘grid’ : { (col,line) : [word, class, dressed_word] } }

Parameters

  • json_file (str) – path to the json file containing the annotations

  • grid_size (int) – number of rows/columns in the output grid, default 64

  • known_class (bool) – True if the classes are available in the json, False otherwise, default True

Returns

dictionary containing the image file name, the coordinates of the words in the grid and their class

Return type

dict

tools.cutie.preprocessing.generate_vocab(folder: str, grid_size: int)¶

Generates the vocabulary of the words contained in all the json annotation files from a folder.

Parameters

  • folder (str) – path to the folder

  • grid_size (int) – grid size that will be used in Cutie

Returns

list of the sentences found in the json files (1 sentence / line)

Return type

list

tools.cutie.preprocessing.is_number(s: str)¶

Asserts if the string passed as parameter is a number

Parameters

s (str) – string to be checked

tools.cutie.preprocessing.visualize_grid(gridmap: dict, nb_cols: int, nb_lines: int)¶

Opens a new window showing the visual representation of the image given as parameter. Image grid has to be prepared with the generate_grids function and given as parameter.

Parameters

  • gridmap (dict) – dictionary prepared with generate_grids function

  • nb_cols (int) – number of columns in the grids

  • nb_lines (int) – number of lines in the grids
